channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024070730
item.description:
Report X-2024070730

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS A 5 GALLON PLASTIC PAIL THAT WAS PUNCTURED AT THE BOTTOM BY A SHARP METAL EDGE DURING SORTATION CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING SORTATION. THE CAP CAME OFF THE PLASTIC JUG CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT INTERNALLY AND COAT ALL THE OTHER JUGS IN THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024070511
item.description:
Report X-2024070511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: WHITE MARSH
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The plastic Jerrican, had been bumped on the top when a Package Handler was lifting it onto a belt. The bump caused a very small dent and puncture in the top corner. A very small amount of the contents were bubbling from that spot.
